general: This law allows the government to use some money from the "Consolidated Fund" to pay for things like salaries, pensions, debt interest, and other expenses during the financial year that ends on March 31st, 2001. The Consolidated Fund is where all the government's money goes, so this act just helps the government make sure it has enough money to cover its spending for that year.

summary: The Consolidated Fund (No.2) Act 2000 allows the government to spend money from the Consolidated Fund for the financial year ending on 31st March 2001. This means that the government can use money from the fund to pay for things like public services and infrastructure projects. The act also sets out how the money will be spent and how much will be used for different purposes. It's important because it helps the government to manage its finances and make sure there is enough money to provide essential services to the public.
